column4: I've XP & Ubuntu. I'd like to install Nexenta (OpenSolaris). Can I install it without disturbing XP/Ubuntu. I'm worried as I'll be resizing the existing partitions.
i've done so without problem.  but i installed solaris express
cool. i'm trying Nexenta as it's similar to Ubuntu. so, resizing existing partitions won't affect Ubuntu/Xp, right?
well, you should back-up any important data before resizing a filesystem
but if you do so, you should be fine and able to recover in the event something goes wrong
fyi, opensolaris has a livecd now too
i tried live cd. but, i wanna try Nexenta (a distro of opensolaris).
how was you experience with opensolaris
i liked it alot, i'll probably transition to it when it officially releases in april
okay, i'll try and share my experience later. hope you catch you on this forum.
Can I install ubuntu apps on OpenSolaris. for example, skpye is availabe for Ubuntu.
there are many opensource apps you can install; check out blastwave.org
also opensolaris comes with some, like pidgin, rhythmbox
i want skype due to video chat
yeah i like skype too, but i haven't tried installing it yet
